me.Salt.Command

Interface ICommand

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CaDAddPlayerCommand, CaDCreateGameCommand, CaDEndGameCommand, CaDInfoCommand, CaDRemovePlayerCommand, CaDScoresCommand, CaDStartGameCommand, CaDViewGamesCommand, CatCommand, DebugCommand, EmojiTextCommand, EvalCommand, GuildInfoCommand, HelpCommand, InfoCommand, IssueCommand, LanguageCommand, PermissionCommand, PingCommand, ProfileInfoCommand, R6GameStatsCommand, RatesCommand, ReminderCommand, RoadmapCommand, SayCommand, ShutdownCommand, SourceCommand, StatisticsCommand, TextChannelInfoCommand, UptimeCommand

    public interface ICommand
    Project title: SaltBot-2.0 Authored by Salt on 10/04/2017.

    This interface defines methods that every Command must implement. Typical operation of a command follows as:

    Operation order: preExecution() -> execute() -> postExecution()

    However, if the preExecution method returns false, no further methods shall be called, and the individual will be notified that they have entered incorrect parameters.

      The execute() method is where a command should place the functional part of the code; the code that actually performs the command's task.
      CommandContainer getCmdContainer()
      This class' purpose acts to ensure that each command extends the Command class.
      void postExecution(CommandParser.ParsedCommandContainer cmd)
      The postExecution() method is the last method called of a command.
      boolean preExecution(CommandParser.ParsedCommandContainer cmd, net.dv8tion.jda.core.events.message.guild.GuildMessageReceivedEvent event)
      preExecution is the first method of a command that is called.

    • Method Detail

      • preExecution

        boolean preExecution(CommandParser.ParsedCommandContainer cmd,
                     net.dv8tion.jda.core.events.message.guild.GuildMessageReceivedEvent event)
              throws LackingPermissionException,
                     MissingDataException,
                     DisabledCommandException
        preExecution is the first method of a command that is called. It allows the command to analyse the parameters inputted by the user, and determine if they follow any patterns that may be required.
        Parameters:
        cmd - CommandParser.ParsedCommandContainer - The parsed command inputted by the user
        event - GuildMessageReceivedEvent - The GuildMessageReceivedEvent that triggered this method being called
        Returns:
        Boolean - A boolean representing if the CommandExecutor should continue with calling any further methods
        Throws:
        LackingPermissionException - Thrown if the individual lacks the permissions to use this command
        MissingDataException - Thrown if the arguments entered by the individual are either missing, lacking in data, or lacking in data that is of the correct type/formatting
        DisabledCommandException - Thrown if the command is marked as disabled

      • execute

        void execute(CommandParser.ParsedCommandContainer cmd,
             net.dv8tion.jda.core.events.message.guild.GuildMessageReceivedEvent e)
        The execute() method is where a command should place the functional part of the code; the code that actually performs the command's task.
        Parameters:
        cmd - CommandParser.ParsedCommandContainer - The parsed command inputted by the user
        e - GuildMessageReceivedEvent - The GuildMessageReceivedEvent that triggered this method being called

      • postExecution

        void postExecution(CommandParser.ParsedCommandContainer cmd)
        The postExecution() method is the last method called of a command. It allows for clear-up processes to be run, and any potential memory leaks to be avoided.
        Parameters:
        cmd - CommandParser.ParsedCommandContainer - The parsed command inputted by the user

      • getCmdContainer

        CommandContainer getCmdContainer()
        This class' purpose acts to ensure that each command extends the Command class.
        Returns:
        CommandContainer - This command's instance of a CommandContainer.
